sgrle.cpp

00001 /* SGRLE.C
00002  RLE compression and decompression functions for the SGRLE format...
00003  These are used for saved games (hence the name SG RLE). Could be used
00004  for other things too, I guess.
00005  
00006  After opening a file for decompression you must call sgrle_reset() before
00007  the first time you use sgrle_decompress().
00008  */
00009 
00010 #include "../../fileio.h"
00011 #include "../../CLogFile.h"
00012 
00013 #define SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW         0xFE
00014 #define SGRLE_RLEMARKEROLD         255
00015 //#define SGRLE_RLEMARKEROLD         0xFE
00016 #define SGRLE_MAXRUNLEN         0xFFF0
00017 int sgrle_runlen;
00018 unsigned char sgrle_runchar;
00019 
00020 /* decompresses the next byte from file FP. */
00021 /* used internally by sgrle_decompress(). */
00022 unsigned char sgrle_get_next_byte(FILE *fp, unsigned char marker)
00023 {
00024  // are we currently in a RLE run?
00025  if (sgrle_runlen)
00026  {
00027   // decrease length of RLE run and return the previously
00028   // read char for the run
00029   sgrle_runlen--;
00030   return sgrle_runchar;
00031  }
00032  else
00033  { // not currently in a RLE run
00034   sgrle_runchar = fgetc(fp);
00035   if (sgrle_runchar==marker)
00036   {  // start of a RLE run
00037    sgrle_runlen = fgeti(fp);
00038    sgrle_runchar = fgetc(fp);
00039    return sgrle_get_next_byte(fp, marker);
00040   }
00041   else return sgrle_runchar;
00042  }
00043 }
00044 
00045 /* resets the decompression engine. (must call this before the first
00046  time you use sgrle_decompress(), each time you open a new file) */
00047 void sgrle_initdecompression(void)
00048 {
00049  sgrle_runlen = 0;
00050 }
00051 
00052 /* decompresses nbytes bytes of SGRLE-compressed data from
00053    file pointer *fp to the memory area pointed to by *ptr.
00054    Newer Version */
00055 char sgrle_decompressV2(FILE *fp, unsigned char *ptr, unsigned long nbytes)
00056 {
00057  unsigned long i;
00058  unsigned long bytes;
00059  
00060  bytes = fgetl(fp);
00061  if (bytes != nbytes)
00062  {
00063   g_pLogFile->ftextOut("sgrle_decompress: bytes stored != bytes asked for ($%08x / $%08x)\n", bytes, nbytes);
00064   g_pLogFile->ftextOut("Trying to extract as much as possible...\n");
00065   //return 1;
00066  }
00067  
00068  if(bytes < nbytes) nbytes = bytes;
00069 
00070  sgrle_runlen = 0;
00071  
00072  for(i=0;i<nbytes;i++)
00073   ptr[i] = sgrle_get_next_byte(fp, SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW);
00074  return 0;
00075 }
00076 
00077 /* decompresses nbytes bytes of SGRLE-compressed data from
00078  * file pointer *fp to the memory area pointed to by *ptr.
00079  * Older Version */
00080 void sgrle_decompressV1(FILE *fp, unsigned char *ptr, unsigned long nbytes)
00081 {
00082  unsigned long i;
00083  for(i=0;i<nbytes;i++)
00084  {
00085   ptr[i] = sgrle_get_next_byte(fp, SGRLE_RLEMARKEROLD);
00086  }
00087 }
00088 
00089 
00090 /* given a memory area *ptr of length nbytes, compresses the data */
00091 /* using the SGRLE algorithm and saves it to file *fp */
00092 void sgrle_compress(FILE *fp, unsigned char *ptr, unsigned long nbytes)
00093 {
00094  int byt;
00095  unsigned long compress_index, run_ahead_index;
00096  unsigned int runlength;
00097  int readbyt;
00098  unsigned int i;
00099  
00100  fputl(nbytes, fp);
00101  
00102  compress_index = 0;
00103  while(compress_index < nbytes)
00104  {
00105   // read a byte from the buffer
00106   readbyt = ptr[compress_index];
00107   
00108   /* is the next byte the same? if so find the length of the run */
00109   if ((compress_index+1 < nbytes) && ptr[compress_index+1]==readbyt)
00110   {
00111    /* find how long the run is (a run of byte readbyt) */
00112    run_ahead_index = (compress_index + 1);
00113    runlength = 1;
00114    do
00115    {
00116     byt = ptr[run_ahead_index];
00117     
00118     // the run is over when either the byte is different
00119     // or run_ahead_index is at the end of the buffer,
00120     // or runlength is approaching FFFF (max possible RLE run length)
00121     if (byt != readbyt || run_ahead_index >= nbytes || runlength >= SGRLE_MAXRUNLEN)
00122     {
00123      break;
00124     }
00125     run_ahead_index++;
00126     runlength++;
00127    } while(1);
00128    
00129    // it takes 4 bytes to code a RLE run, so if the run is less than
00130    // 4 bytes, it would actually be smaller if we didn't compress it
00131    if (runlength < 4 && readbyt != SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW)
00132    {
00133     // RLE run, but too small to bother with
00134     for(i=0;i<runlength;i++) fputc(readbyt, fp);
00135    }
00136    else
00137    {
00138     // save a RLE run
00139     fputc(SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW, fp);
00140     fputi(runlength, fp);
00141     fputc(readbyt, fp);
00142    }
00143    // advance
00144    compress_index += runlength;
00145   }
00146   else
00147   {
00148    // next byte is different, this is not a run, it's just a single char
00149    if (readbyt != SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW)
00150    {
00151     fputc(readbyt, fp);
00152    }
00153    else
00154    {
00155     // it's a single uncompressed byte which is equal to the RLE marker.
00156     // delimit it by placing it in a RLE run of length 1.
00157     fputc(SGRLE_RLEMARKERNEW, fp);
00158     fputi(1, fp);
00159     fputc(readbyt, fp);
00160    }
00161    compress_index++;
00162   }
00163  }
00164  
00165 }
